normal.statement: What is the ultimate source of energy for cellular respiration in plants?

Where does the Krebs cycle take place?
What is the final electron acceptor in aerobic respiration?
Which molecule enters the Krebs cycle?

What is the process called when glucose is broken down in the absence of oxygen?

moderate.statement: During which process is CO₂ released in cellular respiration?
What is the significance of cristae in mitochondria?
options: Increase surface area for ATP production
moderate.answer: Increase surface area for ATP production

moderate.statement: Which of the following is true about anaerobic respiration?
options: It produces more ATP than aerobic respiration
It includes glycolysis followed by fermentation
moderate.answer: It includes glycolysis followed by fermentation

moderate.statement: What happens to pyruvate in aerobic conditions?
options: It is converted to lactic acid
It enters the mitochondria and is converted to acetyl CoA
It is excreted from the cell
moderate.answer: It enters the mitochondria and is converted to acetyl CoA

moderate.statement: Which of the following is NOT a product of the Krebs cycle?
What is the role of oxygen in cellular respiration?
options: It is used to form water
It combines with carbon to form CO₂
It is the final electron acceptor

moderate.statement: How many NADH molecules are produced per glucose molecule during glycolysis?
Which of the following statements about oxidative phosphorylation is correct?
What is the respiratory quotient for proteins?
Which enzyme catalyzes the first step of glycolysis?
What is the net result of the electron transport chain?
Which of the following is a key regulatory enzyme of glycolysis?
What is the fate of NADH produced during glycolysis in aerobic respiration?
options: It enters the electron transport chain
It is converted back to NAD⁺
It is excreted from the cell
moderate.answer: It enters the electron transport chain

moderate.statement: Which of the following processes occurs in both aerobic and anaerobic respiration?
What is the main purpose of fermentation?
How many ATP molecules are produced from one NADH molecule in the electron transport chain?
Which of the following is NOT a stage of aerobic respiration?
What is the significance of the inner mitochondrial membrane being highly folded?
options: To increase surface area for electron transport
moderate.answer: To increase surface area for electron transport

moderate.statement: Which of the following is true about the Krebs cycle?
options: It produces the most ATP directly

moderate.statement: What is the role of ATP synthase in cellular respiration?
options: To convert pyruvate to acetyl CoA

moderate.statement: Which of the following statements about lactic acid fermentation is correct?
How many CO₂ molecules are released per pyruvate molecule during the link reaction?
Which of the following is an amphibolic pathway?
What is the primary function of cellular respiration?
Which of the following processes involves substrate-level phosphorylation?

hard.statement: What is the P/O ratio for NADH in the electron transport chain?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the electron transport chain?
What is the role of coenzyme Q in the electron transport chain?
options: It pumps protons across the membrane
It is a mobile electron carrier
hard.answer: It is a mobile electron carrier

hard.statement: Which of the following statements about the chemiosmotic theory is correct?
options: It explains ATP synthesis in mitochondria
It was proposed by Peter Mitchell

hard.statement: How many ATP molecules are produced from one FADH₂ molecule in the electron transport chain?
Which of the following enzymes is inhibited by high levels of ATP?
What is the significance of the malate-aspartate shuttle?
options: It transports CO₂ out of mitochondria
It transports ATP out of mitochondria

hard.statement: Which of the following is true about uncouplers of oxidative phosphorylation?
options: They allow electron transport without ATP synthesis
hard.answer: They allow electron transport without ATP synthesis

hard.statement: What is the role of cytochrome c in the electron transport chain?
options: It transfers electrons from complex III to complex IV
It pumps protons across the membrane
hard.answer: It transfers electrons from complex III to complex IV

hard.statement: Which of the following is NOT a product of the oxidation of one pyruvate molecule?
What is the net ATP yield from one molecule of glucose during anaerobic respiration?
Which of the following processes occurs in the mitochondrial matrix?
What is the role of oxygen in the electron transport chain?
options: It combines with protons to form water
It is the final electron acceptor

hard.statement: Which of the following is true about the respiratory quotient?
options: RQ for fats is less than 1
RQ for organic acids is more than 1

hard.statement: What is the significance of the glycerol-3-phosphate shuttle?
options: It transports ATP out of mitochondria

hard.statement: Which of the following is an allosteric inhibitor of phosphofructokinase?
What is the role of succinate dehydrogenase in cellular respiration?
options: It is part of the Krebs cycle
It is part of the electron transport chain

hard.statement: Which of the following statements about the Pasteur effect is correct?
What is the net result of one turn of the Krebs cycle?
Which of the following is true about cyanide poisoning?
What is the role of iron-sulfur centers in the electron transport chain?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of fermentation?
options: It yields only 2 ATP per glucose
It produces lactic acid or ethanol

hard.statement: What is the significance of the Q cycle in complex III?
options: It transfers electrons to cytochrome c
It pumps protons across the membrane

hard.statement: Which of the following is true about the ATP yield from glucose?
options: It is not affected by the cell type
It varies depending on the shuttle system used
It is higher in anaerobic conditions
hard.answer: It varies depending on the shuttle system used

hard.statement: What is the role of aconitase in the Krebs cycle?
